summary: This is a U.S. Department of Homeland Security TECS (Treasury Enforcement Communications System) person query record for Jeffrey Epstein, generated on July 1, 2019. It shows he was the subject of a current investigation with a 'silent hit' for travel tracking, indicating law enforcement was monitoring his movements and should be notified immediately if he was encountered traveling.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the TECS query, listed with multiple aliases and identified as the subject of a current investigation with a silent hit for travel tracking.

events.title: TECS Query and Silent Hit Activation
events.description: A TECS person query was generated for Jeffrey Epstein, activating a 'silent hit' for travel tracking purposes from July 1, 2019, to July 1, 2020.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was the subject of an active law enforcement investigation as of July 1, 2019, with a TECS record status of 'SUBJECT OF CURRENT INVESTIGATION'.
A 'silent hit' was placed on Epstein for travel tracking, instructing CBP to notify the record holder immediately if encountered and not to release him prior to contact.
The document notes Epstein was 'known to travel via private aircraft'.
The query was generated by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security and contains strict dissemination warnings, indicating its sensitive law enforcement nature.
